programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Arsenal - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won each of their last three home games against Arsenal in all competitions without conceding a single goal, while they last won four in a row at home to the Gunners in August 1969. programme.title: Crystal Palace vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Crystal Palace have won just one of their last 16 Premier League meetings with Liverpool, winning 1-0 at Anfield in April 2024. The Eagles haven’t scored more than once in any of their last 12 league games against the Reds. Liverpool have won nine and lost none of their last 10 away league games against Crystal Palace – this is their longest ongoing unbeaten run away from home in the league against any side.

programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Manchester United’s Bruno Fernandes has made the most line-breaking passes into the opposition penalty area in the Premier League this season, while the Red Devils captain also ranks first for line-breaking passes that have led to a shot. programme.title: Monaco vs Nice - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Monaco will face OGC Nice for the 131st time in all competitions. Monaco have recorded 58 wins against OGC Nice, a figure they have only achieved against Lyon and Rennes. OGC Nice, in turn, have lost to Monaco 58 times in all competitions, with only defeats against Marseille being more frequent. Monaco have lost three of their last five Ligue 1 matches against Nice, as many defeats as in their previous 12 encounters with OGCN.

programme.title: Le Havre vs Rennes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. Le Havre failed to score for the third time in Ligue 1 in 2025 in their last match at Metz ; only Lyon and Paris SG have failed to score in fewer matches in the competition this calendar year among ever present teams. It was also Le Havre’s second clean sheet of the year, the lowest tally amongst all teams in Ligue 1.

programme.title: Olympique Lyonnais vs Toulouse - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Olympique Lyonnais are unbeaten in their last 17 Ligue 1 matches against Toulouse FC, a longer run in the top-flight has only been recorded against Saint-Étienne. Olympique Lyonnais have conceded just three goals in Ligue 1 this season, the joint-lowest tally in the league alongside Nice, and their fewest after six matches of a top-flight campaign since 2015/16.

programme.title: Auxerre vs Lens - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Auxerre have won only one of their last 10 Ligue 1 matches against Lens but that was the most recent, a 4-0 win in April 2025. Auxerre have won just one of their last 11 home games against Lens in all competitions, after winning seven of the previous eight.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germains biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Metz vs Olympique Marseille - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Metz have not won any of their last nine Ligue 1 matches against Olympique Marseille, only against Paris Saint-Germain and Lille are they currently on a longer winless run in the top-flight. programme.title: World Athletics Championships Tokyo 2025 - Day 4 – Evening Session
programme.desc: The World Athletics Championships 2025The greatest athletes from around the globe compete for glory in Tokyo.The twentieth edition is hosted by the National Stadium, 13th – 21st September.

programme.title: Hania El Hammamy [EGY] vs Nour ElSherbini [EGY] - Women’s Final - QTerminals Qatar Classic 2025 -PS
programme.desc: Defending champion Nour ElSherbini meets Hania El Hammamy in an all-Egyptian blockbuster final in Doha.Defending Qatar Classic champion Nour ElSherbini brings surgical pace and T-dominance—expect rapid volley exchanges and ruthless length. Control of the middle will decide it. ElSherbini reached the final after a straight-games semifinal, while Hania El Hammamy, the 2023 Doha champion, arrives in peak form. A tactical, high-tempo duel for the crown.

programme.title: Moasataf Asal [EGY] vs Paul Coll [NZL] - Men’s Final - QTerminals Qatar Classic 2025 -PSA
programme.desc: World No.1 Mostafa Asal (EGY) meets World No.2 Paul Coll (NZL) at the Khalifa International Tennis and Squash Complex. Asal leads the rivalry and has won the last six meetings. 2025 titles: Asal — World Championship, El Gouna, Optasia; Coll — Canary Wharf, London Classic. Doha record: Asal was 2024 runner-up; Coll reached the finals in 2020 and 2021. Expect fierce T-battles, punishing length, and momentum swings.

programme.title: Race 2 - Hockenheim Round - DTM - 2025
Olympique Lyonnais vs Toulouse - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Olympique Lyonnais are unbeaten in their last 17 Ligue 1 matches against Toulouse FC, a longer run in the top-flight has only been recorded against Saint-Étienne. Olympique Lyonnais have conceded just three goals in Ligue 1 this season, the joint-lowest tally in the league alongside Nice, and their fewest after six matches of a top-flight campaign since 2015/16.

programme.title: Le Havre vs Rennes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. Le Havre failed to score for the third time in Ligue 1 in 2025 in their last match at Metz ; only Lyon and Paris SG have failed to score in fewer matches in the competition this calendar year among ever present teams. It was also Le Havre’s second clean sheet of the year, the lowest tally amongst all teams in Ligue 1.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab.Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan

programme.title: History of the Asian Games
programme.desc: From its beginnings to today, the Asian Games torch lighting has become a dazzling showcase of creativity and technology. Each edition brings fresh innovation, with Doha 2006’s unforgettable horse-and-rider moment still hailed as a highlight. As the 2026 Games in Japan draw near, excitement builds over what new spectacle will capture the world’s imagination.

programme.title: Nantes vs Saint-Raphaël - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Toulouse vs AIX - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

The Art of lighting the Asian Games Flame
programme.desc: The Asian Games torch lighting has become a stage for innovation, blending tradition with modern spectacle. From iconic moments to dazzling surprises, none stand out more than Doha 2006 with its dramatic horse and rider. As the 2026 Games approach in Japan, anticipation grows for the next unforgettable torch lighting ceremony.
